intro: Cirsium verutum, commonly known as the lesser thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with spiny, lobed leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are blue to purple in color, forming a dense, spherical cluster at the top of the stem. Cirsium verutum is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, and it plays a role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
